Function and Class Documentation¶

atesa.main()

Initialize settings object and call the appropriate functions in accordance with user-defined options.

atesa.main_loop(settings)

Perform the sequence of simulations constituting a full ATESA run.

atesa.interact(type, settings)

Handle submitting of jobs to the batch system or looking up of currently queued and running jobs.

atesa.makebatch(thread, settings)

Make the appropriate batch file for the given thread; or, append the appropriate line to the current groupfile.

atesa.subbatch(thread[, direction, logfile, …])

Submit the appropriate batch file for the given thread and direction to the batch system.

atesa.spawnthread(basename[, thread_type, …])

Generate a new Thread object with the desired specifications.

atesa.checkcommit(thread, direction[, …])

Check a currently running Thread for commitment to either of the user-defined basins and return a string indicating the direction of that commitment, if applicable.

atesa.standalone_checkcommit(name, settings)

Check a coordinate file for commitment to either of the user-defined basins and return a string indicating the direction of that commitment, if applicable.

atesa.pickframe(thread, direction[, …])

Write a new restart-format coordinate file using a randomly chosen frame with index between 0 and settings.n_adjust to serve as the initial coordinates for a new simulation.

atesa.get_rc_value(cv_values, settings)

Evaluate and return reaction coordinate value based on a given list of cv_values.

atesa.cleanthread(thread, settings)

Reset thread parameters in preparation for the next step of aimless shooting after the previous one has completed.

atesa.candidatevalues(coord_file[, frame, …])

Evaluate the candidate CV values from the initial coordinates of the most recent step of the given thread.

atesa.revvels(thread)

Write a new restart-format coordinate file by multiplying the velocity values from the most recent “*_init_fwd.rst” file belonging to thread by -1.

atesa.update_progress(progress[, message])

Print a dynamic progress bar to stdout.

atesa.cv_analysis_func(settings)

Produce a subdirectory inside the working directory containing a file for each thread, which in turn contain columns for every CV, giving the value of that CV vs.

atesa.zip_for_transfer_func(settings)

Identify the files necessary to continue aimless shooting and/or analysis from the current state and zip them up for transfer to another directory or filesystem.

atesa.initialize_eps(settings)

Initialize global settings for EPS runs.

atesa.init_find_ts(settings, start_name)

Initialize and perform jobs for constructing transition state guesses from the provided input coordinate files.

atesa.find_ts_loop(settings)

Interpret results of a failed find_ts loop (which consists of submitting TS guesses to main_loop, having all threads terminate, and having no acceptances in any thread) and respond accordingly.

atesa.handle_groupfile([job_to_add, settings])

Update attributes of settings.groupfile_list and return name of the groupfile that should be written to next.

atesa.Thread([settings])

Object representing a series of simulations and containing the relevant information to define its current state.
